I figured I could put it out anyways, even if it'd be 10 hours too early. BUT, we won't be back until late Monday night. Except that next week, trash is a day later because of the holiday this Monday. We can refer you to Greater Boston Legal Services at 617-371-1234.  The State of Massachusetts oversees hospitals.  If you would like to file a formal complaint through the state, you may follow this link: http://www.mass.gov/eohhs/gov/departments/dph/programs/hcq/healthcare-quality/healthcare-facility-complaints/complaints-regarding-hospitals.html. Thank you,. Boston 311 Team.
description:
I started feeling bad at Thursday midnight on June 16 2016. I felt the gas feeling with my stomach and threw up three times with fever. I tried the gas release medication but it's not working. I couldn't pass any of gas and I couldn't sleep for whole night. At the second day I find my right leg couple trample on the floor with pain. So I went to MGH on Friday which is June 17 2017. I suppose to go to emergency room but they send to a walk in clinic, which name is wang clinic. I talked with doctor about all my issue and told him I suspect I have some infection problem inside my belly. He told me I have no fever, which is showed 71f on my doctor note. I insist to do the blood checking and belly ct scan but he said it's waste money and time. He said my problem just food poisoning, which is not a big deal. My friend who went with my asked him do blood check and Ct scan for second time but he rejected again. He did find out my right lower belly tightness and didn't realize anything. He sent me home with pain medication and told me will be fine in two days. 
After two days, the pain medication is not working on me anymore. I went northeastern university health center on June 20 2016. After five minutes talk, the doctor told me that my problem is a very serious problem for appendicitis and transfer me to BIDMC. I did a blood check and ct scan in their emergency room and they told me that my appendix has already open with blood poisoning. Then I stay in the hospital for two weeks and did a surgery on June 28 2016. They cut part of my large and small intestine because of the infection and I have blood clot problem in that time. I go back home from hospital at July 3rd 2016. 
Right now, I'm doing good from surgery but there are some problems for me after this problem. I have a diarrhea always at least three time a day and always liquids. I couldn't hold them, when I feel that I need to rush to restroom and I can exactly know what did I eat from it. I couldn't do any sports because it will make my belly pain. It bring me lost a lot of money for both medical payment and also my school and living expenses because of the medical leave extend my program as a international student. I experience everything almost myself because I have no family here.   I do have all doctor record for what I said above. If you are interested in it. Please call me. My number is 617-784-9098
There is no lawyer want to help me because MGH didn't do any check for me even though I insist to do it. I get medical malpractice because of no actions from them and I couldn't prove my situation because of no actions from them as well. I really don't know what can I do for it. Is it any help I can get from here?

status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. Eversource Electric responding to an oil leak on its major transmission line on your street activated an emergency permit. Emergency work must be performed no matter what time of day or night in the interest of public safety and the protection of private property. This transmission line is critical for the power supply to South Boston. Eversource has been working around the clock to rectify this critical situation. They totally understand the tremendous impact they have had on the residents near this work, and they  apologize for the inconvenience. If you want to reach out to Eversource to discuss this matter further you can email John Hoey at John.Hoey@eversource.com. For any questions or concerns, please contact the number listed below. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) looked into your CRM  and determined the following. BWSC and National Grid are replacing mains in the North End that are 100 years old. The City encourages this type of capital upgrade work.  It will provide dependable utility services to the residents as well as  eliminate future emergency repairs. The City acknowledges that the construction will cause an inconvenience to the residents. However in the long run the replacement of a 100 year old pipes is well worth it. In addition the City is reconstructing Commercial St. I reached out to the utilities and the Engineer in charge of Commercial St. Estimated Completion:. Snow Hill  Oct 2017. Hull St  June 2017. Hanover St  July 2017. Commercial St  November 2017. The contact person for BWSC is Irene McSweeney at 617-989-7000. For Commercial St you can contact Kay Barned-Smith at 617-388-0363. For any questions or concerns, please contact the number listed below. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.
description:

Standard marked spaces are 22ft long per code, whereas "naturally" parked cars need only 16-18ft.
